ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This is research for credit so you will get what you get out of it in terms of your research. For me, that would be working intensely on basic science research.
I learned a lot of research skills, as well as experience in making posters and writing reports.
lab skills such as westerns and gda
Lab research
Scientific experiment skills
This is the only class that I feel really taught me practical skills. The opportunity to do my own research was the highlight of my time at Yale.
Resesrch

I learned how to become more independent in designing and organizing my own experiments and how to work collaboratively with other members of the lab in asking them for feedback on troubleshooting or with my proposal/report/presentation.
I was able to focus more on research during the semester and this helped me be more involved in my research.
I improved my research skills and learned how to make a research poster.
foundational research, synthesizing research into a 15-20 page paper

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths - You get to do research--for a grade!
Weaknesses - There are little to no check-ins with students, and therefore, grading might be a mystery.
Strength was that it was hands off and just accompanied lab, but thats also a weakness in that there wasnt much support.
the research poster session was fun, but shouldve been included on the syllabus

Lack of communication between Professor and students. This caused a lot of undue stress and confusion regarding even simple things. I never once directly heard from the professor even though I contacted him multiple times asking for clarifications

Strength: independence and engagement

weakness: poor communication on requirements and assignments: use canvas more please
This course was a bit disorganized, expectations were slightly unclear and I wish they gave more examples of previous work to set the standard.

Strengths: lots of freedom to pursue any desired research project, flexibility

Weaknesses: lack of clear communication on deadlines and details for the poster
The course allows students to be involved in research. The poster and research report helped me learn to present my research effectively as well.
Enjoyed the opportunity to give a talk or have a poster at the end
this class is an excellent way to get credit for the research you do in the semester

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you're in the MB&B major and you love the research you are working on!
Would recommend if youre already doing research in a lab.
yes! its a fun way to get credit for lab work
Yes! For the research skills you will gain
Yes, but be prepared for 10+ hours of research and writing assignments. Still better than a traditional class in my opinion.
Any student who does not take an independent research course is wasting the opportunity of a lifetime.
Yes

I would recommend this course to another student since I think it's necessary for every MB&B student to have research experience. This course was also a good way to learn lab skills in the context of an actual long-term project.
I would recommend this course to another student looking to engage in research during the semester.
I recommend this course to any student interested in doing research.
Yes!
Yes! if you are participating in independent research
